result.execSummary:
The defendant Christa Marie Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $2,150.00 TO North Shore Bank.  Joint and several with Danielle Tyacke 15CF002344.

Pay DNA surcharge, court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civi judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment. Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association  with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with North Shore Bank locaed at 10533 W. National Avenue, Karly H., Stephanie D., Cathy S. and Kristin E.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christa Marie Williams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christa Marie Williams in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Christa Marie Williams in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 99 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 54 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 45 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 125 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $$2,150.00 joint/several with Danielle Tyacke  15CF002344  payable to North Shore Bank to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-No contact with North Shore Bank located at 10533 W. National Avenue; Karly H., Stephanie D., Cathy S., and Kristin E. 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement 
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Defendant Christa Marie Williams in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Christa Marie Williams in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Christa Marie Williams not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 21.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, Defendant Christa Marie Williams not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christa Marie Williams in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Christa Marie Williams in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.
Clerk:  jms

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NORTHSHORE BANK (ANY BRANCH) AND CO-DEF:  DANIELLE TYACKE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Christa Marie Williams in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Christa Marie Williams in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
